page.title: 05House Improvements-Sheerness
page.content: In about 1982, after a survey was done by Kent University, part of Sheerness was designated an "action area" by the{government. The area stretches from Marine Parade to Unity Street and includes mostly terraced{housing}dating from the late 19th century. They were designated as such because they had no bathrooms and the findings of the report revealed that nearly 70% were on the{poverty}line. As an "action area"{Home Improvement {Grants}were funded direct from central government and ranged from 30% to 90%. One lady interviewed said she was given a 60% grant on Â£7,000 worth of improvements.These included a new roof and supports,new bathroom and toilet (previously outdoor),guttering,doors, windows and a replacement kitchen.The house was rewired and damp proofed.
